Word

oblige (verb)

  • To oblige a person or entity to do something is to require or force them to do it, either because of a law or rule, or because it is necessary.
  • To simply oblige someone is to do them a favor.

‚ÄúThe law obliges the government to release certain documents to the public.‚Äù
‚ÄúWhen my friend needed someone to taste test his new recipe for the cooking competition, I was happy to oblige.‚Äù
